item.title: RT by @juderogers: For anyone following this thread who wants to sample the magazine, I've been slowly going through old issues and interviewing the people who wrote for it. It's been a long project and still more to do... https://wholehoggblog.wordpress.com/
item.dc:creator: @WholeHogg
item.description:
For anyone following this thread who wants to sample the magazine, I've been slowly going through old issues and interviewing the people who wrote for it. It's been a long project and still more to do...
wholehoggblog.wordpress.com/

item.title: R to @justindquirk: Absolutely! Rob, you’re an amazing writer and I miss reading your stuff!

item.title: RT by @juderogers: And I was watching New Order with Robert Smith because I had gone to Germany to interview him for the last ever issue of The Word. Perhaps the greatest assignment / magazine evah.
item.dc:creator: @rob_fitzpatrick
item.description:
And I was watching New Order with Robert Smith because I had gone to Germany to interview him for the last ever issue of The Word. Perhaps the greatest assignment / magazine evah.

item.title: RT by @juderogers: And here’s your excellent Martin Amis piece in the final issue. Culled from my stash of Word mags. Can’t believe it’s 10 years…
item.dc:creator: @Stephen79476550
item.description: And here’s your excellent Martin Amis piece in the final issue. Culled from my stash of Word mags. Can’t believe it’s 10 years…

item.title: RT by @juderogers: Really miss the Word. Wonderful writing and discovered loads of stuff through it like the Wire tv show, John Grant and David Peace.
item.dc:creator: @deanvin19
item.description: Really miss the Word. Wonderful writing and discovered loads of stuff through it like the Wire tv show, John Grant and David Peace.

item.title: R to @mrpfitz: It was ALL culture! Tv, film, documentaries, books, radio, everything.
item.dc:creator: @juderogers

item.title: R to @juderogers: They took on a young woman of 25 whose only recent experience was making a fanzine and always made me feel I could write about anything and anyone. It doesn’t always feel that way. Thank you, @MarkE11en @Nndroid @davidhepworth. I love you and I don’t care who knows it ❤️❤️❤️
item.dc:creator: @juderogers
item.description: They took on a young woman of 25 whose only recent experience was making a fanzine and always made me feel I could write about anything and anyone. It doesn’t always feel that way. Thank you, @MarkE11en @Nndroid @davidhepworth. I love you and I don’t care who knows it ❤️❤️❤️

item.title: R to @juderogers: I did covers on @RobertPlant and @paulwellerHQ, wrote front section pieces on gobby new pop stars Lily Allen and Adele and wrote reviews of Brian Eno reissues & Paul Simon’s collected solo albums “because I’m bored of old blokes like me going on about them” (Paul Du Noyer, 2003).
item.dc:creator: @juderogers
item.description: I did covers on @RobertPlant and @paulwellerHQ, wrote front section pieces on gobby new pop stars Lily Allen and Adele and wrote reviews of Brian Eno reissues & Paul Simon’s collected solo albums “because I’m bored of old blokes like me going on about them” (Paul Du Noyer, 2003).

item.title: Ten years ago today, Word Magazine closed its doors. It was where I began as a journalist, and where my heart lies still. I wrote features about everything and everyone for them. Martin Amis. Amy Winehouse. Tony Benn. Arcade Fire. Allison Pearson. Kirsty Young. Sheila Hancock.
item.dc:creator: @juderogers
item.description: Ten years ago today, Word Magazine closed its doors. It was where I began as a journalist, and where my heart lies still. I wrote features about everything and everyone for them. Martin Amis. Amy Winehouse. Tony Benn. Arcade Fire. Allison Pearson. Kirsty Young. Sheila Hancock.
